publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1498 Mr Brian Monteith: Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers—That the Parliament recognises the supreme bravery displayed by the pipers of the Highland regiments during the First World War and that they inspired Scottish troops into battle on behalf of our country, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to consider what action can be taken to erect a suitable and lasting national memorial as a mark of respect to the many hundreds of pipers who gallantly led from the front and were often wounded or killed in battle.

S1M-1498 Mr Brian Monteith: Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers—That the Parliament recognises the supreme bravery displayed by the pipers of the Highland regiments during the First World War and that they inspired Scottish troops into battle on behalf of our country, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to consider what action can be taken to erect a suitable and lasting national memorial as a mark of respect to the many hundreds of pipers who gallantly led from the front and were often wounded or killed in battle.
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Dorothy-Grace Elder*
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Alex Johnstone*, Mr Keith Harding*
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Michael Russell*
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Dr Winnie Ewing*

S1M-1498 Mr Brian Monteith: Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers—That the Parliament recognises the supreme bravery displayed by the pipers of the Highland regiments during the First World War and that they inspired Scottish troops into battle on behalf of our country, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to consider what action can be taken to erect a suitable and lasting national memorial as a mark of respect to the many hundreds of pipers who gallantly led from the front and were often wounded or killed in battle. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Johnstone, Mr Keith Harding, Michael Russell, Dr Winnie Ewing
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Andrew Wilson*
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Mary Scanlon*, Mr Jamie McGrigor*
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Phil Gallie*, Mr Duncan Hamilton*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Ben Wallace*, Mrs Margaret Ewing*

S1M-1498 Mr Brian Monteith: Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers—That the Parliament recognises the supreme bravery displayed by the pipers of the Highland regiments during the First World War and that they inspired Scottish troops into battle on behalf of our country, and calls upon the Scottish Executive to consider what action can be taken to erect a suitable and lasting national memorial as a mark of respect to the many hundreds of pipers who gallantly led from the front and were often wounded or killed in battle. Supported by: Dorothy-Grace Elder, Alex Johnstone, Mr Keith Harding, Michael Russell, Dr Winnie Ewing, Andrew Wilson, Mary Scanlon, Mr Jamie McGrigor, Phil Gallie, Mr Duncan Hamilton, Mr Adam Ingram, Ben Wallace, Mrs Margaret Ewing
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Mr John Munro*
S1M-1498 Tribute to Scottish Battlefield Pipers (lodged on 22 December 2000) Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*, Mr Jamie Stone*
